questions.question_text: During the execution of production for a bike, a PM was hired. One month later, the PM has been receiving multiple project report requests from stakeholders. Which of the following should the PM do FIRST?

choices.C: Assign this task to the project team.
choices.A: Discuss the requests with the sponsor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A Communication Plan is a crucial project document that outlines how communication will be managed throughout the project. It specifies who needs what information, how the information will be communicated, and when to distribute it. By first reviewing the Communication Plan, the PM can identify the predefined communication needs and expectations, and then align the incoming requests with what has been planned. If the requests are not in alignment, the PM will have a basis for a conversation with stakeholders or the sponsor about potentially revising the Communication Plan.

Selected Answer: D
D - The first step for the project manager should be to review the communication plan. This plan outlines how project information is communicated to stakeholders, including the frequency, format, and content of project reports. By reviewing the communication plan, the project manager can ensure that the requests from stakeholders align with the established communication approach. If necessary, adjustments can be made to the plan to accommodate the requests. This ensures that communication is consistent and aligned with the project's overall strategy.

Selected Answer: C
C - When a team member discovers a malfunctioning procedure in the system, the first step should be to create a record in the issue log. This allows the issue to be formally documented, ensuring that it is tracked and managed appropriately. Once the issue is recorded, the project team can proceed with analyzing the problem, detailing a proposed solution, and taking appropriate actions. Updating the risk register, documenting the finding in the change log, and detailing a proposed solution can all follow after the initial issue is recorded in the issue log.

choices.B: Document the finding in the change log.
choices.C: Create a record in the issue log

questions.question_text: A project team has identified a bug during user acceptance testing. Which of the following is the BEST method for communicating that bug to the development team?

choices.A: Call the development lead to discuss the fixes for the bug.
choices.D: Add the bug issue to the project's risk register.
choices.B: Include the bug issue as part of the status update for stakeholders.

discussion.content: I am going with A. Nowhere in the question does it say there is a fix for the bug. If so, then a change request to implement the fix would be needed.

Selected Answer: C
The best method for communicating a bug identified during user acceptance testing to the development team is "C. Issue a change request."

In a formal project management environment, change requests are the standard method for proposing changes or actions such as bug fixes. These change requests are usually documented and go through a formal review process, which often includes an impact analysis, a review by a change control board, and proper authorization before the change (in this case, the bug fix) is implemented. Issuing a change request ensures that the problem is properly documented, analyzed, and approved, maintaining the integrity of the project and ensuring that everyone is on the same page.

Selected Answer: C
C - When a bug is identified during user acceptance testing, issuing a change request is the most appropriate method for communicating the bug to the development team. A change request outlines the need for a change (in this case, fixing the bug) and provides the necessary details for the development team to address the issue. This process ensures that the bug is formally documented, tracked, and managed in a structured manner. While communication with the development lead and stakeholders is important, issuing a change request is specifically designed for addressing and resolving issues such as bugs.

Selected Answer: B
B - In most cases, internal issues and potential delays are handled within the project team and stakeholders before they are communicated to end users. This is to ensure that the right information is being passed along and also to provide time to find potential solutions or workarounds before involving the end user.

questions.question_text: Internal project team members and a subject matter expert had a heated discussion about the client's needs. The deliverable is now at risk of being delayed. Which of the following should be notified LAST?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When incremental value is expected in a timeboxed period, the most appropriate methodology/framework to use is "C. Scrum."

Scrum is an agile framework that aims for the incremental delivery of a high-value product. It operates in timeboxed intervals known as "sprints," which typically last two to four weeks. During each sprint, a potentially shippable product increment is developed and delivered, offering stakeholders an opportunity to interact with a working version of the product early in the project. This fits well with the requirement for incremental value in a timeboxed period.

Selected Answer: C
C - Scrum is an agile methodology that is designed to deliver incremental value in time-boxed sprints, typically lasting 1-4 weeks. At the end of each sprint, a potentially shippable increment of the product is delivered, allowing for regular delivery of value and feedback.
